articles.title: Webb Telescope Captures Neptune’s Long-Hidden Auroras in Stunning Detail - SciTechDaily
articles.description: Long-Sought Auroral Glow Finally Emerges Under Webb’s Powerful Gaze Neptune lies in the cold, dark reaches of the outer edges of our solar system, about 3 billion miles from the Sun, at the farthest edge of the planetary lineup. Only one spacecraft has ever f…
articles.content: Neptune’s elusive auroras have finally been captured in stunning detail by NASA’s James Webb Space Telescope. Using its powerful infrared capabilities, scientists detected glowing auroral activity un… [+9240 chars]
